intro: Convolvulus peduncularis, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, characterized by its trailing or climbing habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often opening in the morning and closing by midday. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often twining. The seeds are enclosed in a capsule and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
